main_text.sentence: Orthologous proteins – orthologs were found using blastp [22] with a P-value threshold of 10-7, and alignment length threshold of 0.3.
Orthologous mouse loci were identified by similarly retrieving mouse genomic mappings for mouse cDNAs defined as orthologs to the human cDNAs in GeneLynx [31].

In addition to the PDK1 orthologue, which was identified previously [26], there is at least one more putative group X member, orthologous to a recently identified human and mouse PKD1 homologue PKD1L2 [47].

The expected correlations are greater than zero for all five species; so putative PPIs are actually given positive scores for the existence of an orthologous pair, corresponding to the notion that PPIs are more likely to have pairs of orthologs [21].
Orthologues of all four of these proteins (Pol3, Cdc1, Cdc27 and Cdm1) make up mammalian Pol δ [14,15].
Orthologous sequences were isolated using the FlyCatcher program [12].

source_text.title: Gapped BLAST and PSI-BLAST: a new generation of protein database search programs
